contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Politician |image=Kay Hull at the Reserve Forces Day service in Wagga Wagga.jpg |imagesize=150px |caption=Kay Hull at the 2010 Reserve Forces Day service celebrations in Wagga Wagga |honorific-prefix = [[The Honourable]] |name = Kay Hull |honorific-suffix = |birth_date ={{Birth date and age|1954|02|03|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Guyra, New South Wales|Guyra]], [[New South Wales]], [[Australia]] |residence = [[Wagga Wagga, New South Wales]] |death_date = |death_place = |office = |term_start = 3 October 1998 |term_end = 19 July 2010 |predecessor = [[Noel Hicks]] |successor = [[Michael McCormack (Australian politician)|Michael McCormack]] |party = [[National Party of Australia|National Party]] |religion = |constituency_MP = [[Division of Riverina|Riverina]] |parliament = Australian |majority = |spouse = |children = |website = http://www.kayhull.com.au |footnotes = }} [[Image:KayHullCaricature.JPG|thumb|left|upright|Caricature of Kay Hull on Regional Express Saab 340 aircraft]] '''Kay Elizabeth Hull''' (born 3 February 1954), [[Australia]]n politician, was a [[National Party of Australia|National Party]] member of the [[Australian House of Representatives]] from October 1998 to July 2010, representing the [[Division of Riverina]], [[New South Wales]]. ==Personal life== She was born in [[Guyra, New South Wales|Guyra]], [[New South Wales]], and was a small business owner and operator before entering politics.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.abc.net.au/tv/qanda/mp-profiles/rive.htm |title=Find Your Local MP |author= |date= |work=Q&A |publisher=[[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] |accessdate=22 January 2010}}</ref> She was a member of the [[Wagga Wagga City Council]] 1991-98. A small caricature of her is displayed on a [[Regional Express Airlines|Regional Express]] [[Saab 340]] aircraft.<ref>{{cite web | title =Biography for HULL, Kay Elizabeth | publisher =[[Parliament of Australia]] | url =http://parlinfo.aph.gov.au/parlInfo/search/display/display.w3p;query=Id%3A%22handbook%2Fallmps%2F83O%22 | accessdate = 23 January 2010 }}</ref> On 6 April 2010, Kay Hull announced that she wouldn't be contesting the next Federal election, after 12 years serving the [[Division of Riverina|Riverina electorate]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Nationals MP Kay Hull won't contest seat of Riverina at Federal election |author= |publisher=Herald Sun |date=6 April 2010 |url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/breaking-news/nationals-mp-kay-hull-wont-contest-seat-of-riverina-at-federal-election/story-e6frf7jx-1225850635533 |accessdate=6 April 2010}}</ref> In April 2010, [[Charles Sturt University]] named The Kay Hull Veterinary Teaching Hospital in its South Campus in honour of Kay Hull.<ref>{{cite news |title=CSU names vet hospital in Kay Hull's honour |first=Ben |last=Higgins |publisher=The Daily Advertiser |date=15 April 2010 |url=http://www.dailyadvertiser.com.au/news/local/news/general/csu-names-vet-hospital-in-kay-hulls-honour/1803709.aspx |accessdate=15 April 2010}}</ref> In May 2010, [[Regional Express Airlines]] named Kay Hull Conference Room at the Australian Airline Pilot Academy in honour of Kay Hull.<ref>{{cite news |title=Rex pilot training school opens |publisher=The Daily Advertiser |date=31 May 2010 |url=http://www.dailyadvertiser.com.au/multimedia/13287/65771/rex-pilot-training-school-opens.aspx?Start=0&page=1 |accessdate=31 May 2010}}</ref> In March 2011, she was awarded the Freedom of City by Wagga Wagga city council for her "tenacity, resilience, courage and conviction in her representation of her constituents."<ref>[http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2011/03/21/3169077.htm?site=riverina Kay Hull to be awarded Freedom of the City] ABC News online. 21 March 2011. Retrieved 30 August 2011.</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{wikinewspar|Kay Hull crosses floor in Australian House of Representatives on Telstra legislation}} {{commons category}} {{s-start}} {{s-par|au}} {{succession box | title=Member for [[Division of Riverina|Riverina]] | before=[[Noel Hicks]] | after=[[Michael McCormack (Australian politician)|Michael McCormack]] | years=1998â€“2010}} {{s-end}} <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]] --> {{Persondata |NAME=Hull, Kay Elizabeth |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= |SHORT DESCRIPTION=Australian politician |DATE OF BIRTH=3 February 1954 |PLACE OF BIRTH=[[Guyra, New South Wales]], [[Australia]] |DATE OF DEATH=living |PLACE OF DEATH= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hull, Kay}} [[Category:1954 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:National Party of Australia politicians]] [[Category:Members of the Australian House of Representatives]] [[Category:Members of the Australian House of Representatives for Riverina]] [[Category:People from Wagga Wagga]] [[Category:Women members of the Australian House of Representatives]]
